CANDIDATE   Eckart Ehlers  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
 
Location:   Germany – Garbsen  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
Ph.D. in Law and Economics on „Electricity and Gas Supply Network Unbundling in 
Germany, Great Britain and The Netherlands and the Law of the European Union“ 
Universiteit van Tilburg, Netherlands: 10/2004 – 06/2009  
 
UK: Master of Laws (LL.M.) in European and International Trade Law with Distinction  
University of Leicester 09/1999 – 09/2000  
 
Trainee Lawyer (Second State (“Bar”) Exam with honors) including post -graduate 
studies at German University for Administrative Sciences (Deutsche Hochschule für 
Verwaltungswissenschaften), Speyer State of Bavaria, Germany 10/1996 – 11/1998  
 
Studies in Law and Business Economics (First  State Exam combined with degree in 
Business Economics) Universität Bayreuth, Germany 10/1991 – 02/1996  
 
Languages  
German – mother tongue  
English – proficiency  
Dutch – proficiency  
French - Intermediate  
 
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
Aug 2021 to date enercity Erneuerbare GmbH  
Position: Head of Legal, Insurance and Compliance  
Large nationwide wind onshore and open space photovoltaic plant developer.  
Advising senior management, project development and operations departments, 
drafting, negotiating and remedying co mplex (project and land use) contracts, legal 
due diligence of wind parks to be acquired, restructuring special purpose vehicles, 
supervising the dealing with company house and land register matters; managing legal 
advisors.  
 
Aug 2018 to Dec 2020 Urenco Limited  
Position: Director of Government Affairs Germany and Legal Counsel  
World’s second largest (multi -national) uranium enricher with plants in the U.S., 
Germany, the Netherlands and the U.K.  
    
• Highly rated representation and management of politica l and legal company 
interests, inter alia by protecting its site from closure by federal legislation, 
lobbying politicians and being the interface to federal and state administration 
(also in the area of mobile hydrogen storage technology)  
• Trustfully advis ing CEO, General Counsel and German site; successfully 
managing group project on export management and participating in planning 
public affairs engagement  
• Actively representing company interests in nuclear industry association KernD  
• Selected by German CEO Dr Thomas Haeberle (former member of executive 
board of Evonik); member of team of five headed by U.S. American Melissa 
Mann with other members from the U. S., the U.K. and the Netherlands  
 
Nov 2014 to Jul 2018 GETEC net AG  
Position: Head of Regulatory Affiars  
Nationwide operator of industrial site and local / quarter electricity networks.  
• Highly rated negotiations as authorised representative and interface t o energy 
sector regulators  
• Successfully establishing and implementing regulatory compliance 
management and controlling in  close cooperation with CEO and finance and 
software engineering departments; managing legal  and economic advisors  
• Successfully managin g special projects such as developing a regulatory 
business case of  connecting the electricity grid of a Dutch sea port to the 
German transmission network and bidding  for a municipal licence to build and 
operate energy distribution networks  
 
Oct 2011 to Ju n 2014 Gasunie Deutschland Services  
Position: Head of Legal and Project Manager Investment Controlling  
German part of Dutch -German gas transmission system operator  
• Closely collaborating with regulatory affairs and business development 
departments and parti cipating in negotiations with the regulatory agency and in 
the commercial evaluation of regulatory issues; managing legal advisors and 
budget of 450,000 EUR  
• Successfully completing or participating in major projects, also within multi -
national teams, and n egotiating complex contracts such as share deal and 
operations agreements for the Northern European natura

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
